h2_title: Yaoguai Chief Miniboss Fight - Non-White (Round Two)
content: With so many feinting attacks and vanishing, it can be hard to get a bead on him, and unfortunately, he tends to escape from Immobilization almost instantly, so you'll need to save that for when his frozen sword regenerates, and instead focus on deflecting his wild strikes to stop him in his tracks. Since many of his attacks are low to the ground, it's not a bad idea to swap to the Pillar Stance during this phase to attack him from above, rather than continuing to rely on the Smash Stance to see through his attacks if he'll just feint away.
promot:
This is an excerpt from the file 'Valley_of_Ecstasy_Walkthrough.md', within the main section titled 'Valley of Ecstasy Walkthrough', specifically from the subsection 'Yaoguai Chief Miniboss Fight - Non-White (Round Two)'.
The content is as follows:
With so many feinting attacks and vanishing, it can be hard to get a bead on him, and unfortunately, he tends to escape from Immobilization almost instantly, so you'll need to save that for when his frozen sword regenerates, and instead focus on deflecting his wild strikes to stop him in his tracks. Since many of his attacks are low to the ground, it's not a bad idea to swap to the Pillar Stance during this phase to attack him from above, rather than continuing to rely on the Smash Stance to see through his attacks if he'll just feint away.
